intro: Gleasonia duidana var. oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Gleasonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often glaucous in appearance. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by bracts, giving it a distinctive visual appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly found in cultivation outside its native range.
